curatedContent.name: FN-Approved BBQ
curatedContent.contentDescription: There's nothing quite like authentic barbecue in the summertime. Whether you prefer righteous racks of ribs or pit-smoked pulled pork, Kansas City- or North Carolina-style sauce, we've got Food Network-approved BBQ picks from coast to coast.

curatedContent.name: Chicago
curatedContent.contentDescription: Chicago's mix of local and global cuisines will satisfy any eaterâ€™s cravings. Travel to the heart of the Midwest to experience Windy City favorites, like deep-dish pizza, Italian meats and loaded hot dogs.

restaurants.restaurantName: Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinder Co.

curatedContent.name: Cupcake Wars
curatedContent.contentDescription: It's cupcake vs. cupcake in Food Network's tastiest competition yet! Each week on Cupcake Wars, four of the country's top cupcake bakers face off in three elimination challenges until only one decorator remains. The sweet prize: $10,000 and the opportunity to showcase their cupcakes at the winning gig.

curatedContent.name: San Francisco
curatedContent.contentDescription: Fresh, regional cuisine and on-the-go food trucks abound in the Bay City. Experience comfortable California cuisine after a day of biking the Golden Gate Bridge, touring Alcatraz and riding timeless cable cars.

curatedContent.name: Austin
curatedContent.contentDescription: From classic barbecue to fresh tex-mex, hearty burgers to savory crepes and fun food trucks, Austin offers a deliciously eclectic mix of traditional Texas cuisine and innovative artisanal fare.

curatedContent.name: Spring Break Road Trip
curatedContent.contentDescription: Jump into spring break with a trip down South. Start fueling up at South Carolinaâ€™s Caribbean cantina, Fuel Charleston, where locals swear by the jerk chicken sandwich. Stop by Tybee Island near Savannah, Georgia, where crab comes by the platter, piled high with other tasty Georgia shellfish. Then, travel all around Floridaâ€™s coastline where you can sample everything from BBQ to Cuban cuisine.

curatedContent.name: Miami
curatedContent.contentDescription: Miami's reputation for dancing and music go hand-in-hand with its spicy Latin cuisine. After enjoying a day at the beach, grab a refreshing dish courtesy of the ocean or grab a pitcher of sangria to share with friends. From Italian to Cuban to New American and Chinese, Miami casts a wide net in finding the best, freshest flavors.

curatedContent.name: New York
curatedContent.contentDescription: The city that never sleeps is known for its melting pot-like mix of global ingredients and cuisines. In between jaunts to the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building and Central Park, make time to sample the Big Appleâ€™s eclectic offerings of international eats, drinks, street food and more.

curatedContent.name: Los Angeles
curatedContent.contentDescription: After a day of surfing, glamour shopping and touring Hollywood's best sights, unwind by experiencing LA's diverse restaurant scene. Big-time celebrities and local folks alike enjoy the countless international eateries, chic cafes and roadside diners serving fresh local food with famous coastal flavors.

curatedContent.name: New Orleans
curatedContent.contentDescription: Take a bite out of the Big Easy with restaurant picks from Guy, Giada, Rachael and more Food Network chefs. Boasting a plentiful mix of fine dining and casual cafes, New Orleans is home to distinctive Creole and Cajun dishes, like po-boys, gumbo and muffulettas, that bring food lovers back to the bayou year after year.  Let the good times -- and the good eats -- roll.

curatedContent.name: AprÃ¨s Ski New England
curatedContent.contentDescription: Ski season is in full swing and a winter wonderland welcomes enthusiastic snow-lovers to Vermont, New Hampshire and Upstate New York. But the exhilaration doesnâ€™t end when the slopes close. Pull off your goggles and boots and discover Food Network chefsâ€™ favorite wintry stops in New England.

curatedContent.name: Wake-Up Worthy Breakfast Spots
curatedContent.contentDescription: Make the most important meal of the day the most delicious with breakfast favorites from around the country. From ooey, gooey cinnamon buns at Chicago restaurant Ann Sather to fluffy made-from-scratch biscuits at Nashville's Loveless CafÃ© to fresh bagels with lox from Lowell's Restaurant & Bar in Seattle's famed Pike Place Market, you're sure to find a delicious reason to rise, shine â€” and dine.

curatedContent.name: Warming Comfort Food
curatedContent.contentDescription: With cold weather creeping in across much of the country, it's time to find the best of the best when it comes to warm and homey, rich and hearty comfort food. We're talking stick-to-your-ribs-and-make-you-feel-like-you're-being-hugged food, and you'll find this over-the-top goodness at these great restaurants.

curatedContent.name: Washington, D.C.
curatedContent.contentDescription: In between visiting Washington, D.C.'s many monuments, experience the nation's rich culinary history at a mix of modern and historical restaurants. The Capitol's eateries celebrate American cooking traditions with farm-to-table dinners, fresh local seafood and an extraordinary selection of the nation's finest, handcrafted beers.

restaurants.restaurantName: Round Robin Bar at The Willard Hotel

curatedContent.name: All-American Pie
curatedContent.contentDescription: Finish off any feast with an irresistible piece of pie. Something about the buttery crust and rich filling always brings thoughts of comfort and nostalgia, and weâ€™ve rounded up plenty of restaurants dishing out just-like-mama-made pecan and apple pies. Thereâ€™s also a few outside-the-crust options (could you turn down something called the Fat Elvis Pie?), so browse through and grab a slice (or two)!

restaurants.restaurantName: Pie Moms at The Berry Manor Inn

curatedContent.name: Las Vegas
curatedContent.contentDescription: Sin City prides itself on a balance of budget-friendly buffets and over-the-top gourmet restaurants. Whether youâ€™re taking in a show, betting it all at the slots or just lounging poolside, make time for a bite to eat at one of Las Vegasâ€™ famed restaurants or get your fill at a low-cost buffet.

curatedContent.name: Best Sandwiches in 50 States
curatedContent.contentDescription: Sliced bread is the measure against which we judge all the best things in life because without it we wouldnâ€™t have one of the most ingenious food inventions of all time: the sandwich. Food Network Magazine scoured America to find the single must-eat sandwich in each state. Now itâ€™s your turn: Get out there and try them!

curatedContent.name: Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives
curatedContent.contentDescription: Hit the road with Guyas he travels coast to coast in search of the country's must-try "greasy spoon" spots. From some of the nation's best fried clams to a classic American burger turned head-over-heels with Asian flavor, you'll be the one telling your friends, "You gotta see this."

curatedContent.name: Food Network's BBQ Road Trip
curatedContent.contentDescription: Sample smoke-kissed favorites, from baby back ribs to beef brisket to tender and saucy pulled pork.

curatedContent.name: Meatpacking District/Chelsea Road Trip
curatedContent.contentDescription: The Sex and the City glamour district is still a scene, full of designer boutiques, velvet ropes and some of the cityâ€™s hottest restaurants. Youâ€™ll find favorites from The Best Thing I Ever Ate as well as restaurants owned by Food Network chefs like Alex Guarnaschelli and Masaharu Morimoto. Tip: Since many establishments serve food until the wee hours, this area is a great choice for late-night dining.

curatedContent.name: Eat Like An Iron Chef
curatedContent.contentDescription: Recreate some of the most drool-worthy moments of Next Iron Chef by heading to the winnersâ€™ and competitorsâ€™ restaurants. From the deliciously experimental small plates at Jehangir Mehtaâ€™s Graffiti to Geoffrey Zakarianâ€™s The Lamb's Club and the phenomenal Asian fusion at Morimoto, youâ€™re bound to find a secret ingredient to your liking.

curatedContent.name: Theater District Road Trip
curatedContent.contentDescription: The ultimate tourist destination in the city has its fair share of great restaurants that the locals flock to as well. Try Guyâ€™s favorite international dive Gazalaâ€™s Place, or sample the bold flavors at Bobbyâ€™s brasserie Bar Americain. Tip: Don't expect to catch a cab after taking in a show. Itâ€™s easier to take the subway or walk.
